function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Anxiety, depression, and suicide risk due to isolation for remote workers","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Loss of control over work due to covid-19 restrictions","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased psychological health problems in the workplace","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced human movement due to lockdowns","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinformation about the nature of covid-19","category":"Disinformation and Misinformation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Linking covid-19 to natural catastrophic events","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Existing remedies being re-purposed to combat covid-19","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Pandemic or endemic created by human activities","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Forbidding contact between people from different households","category":"Social and Psychological Effects","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Participants impacted by an epidemic","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High percentage of participants directly involved in projects","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Survey data collected from multiple continents and countries, potentially increasing the risk of exposure to contagious diseases during data collection.","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Close-ended and open-ended survey questions may lead to qualitative and quantitative data collection, potentially capturing complex and diverse perspectives on the impact of contagious diseases in the built environment.","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of specific description of ’possible sample’ leading to sampling bias","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Adoption of easy random sampling without consideration of population characteristics","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in credibility of personal opinions over scientific data","category":"Cultural and Lifestyle Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public trust in medical professionals","category":"Social and Psychological Effects","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Informal settlements and urban poor may not have access to safe physical activity options at home","category":"Access to infrastructure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Substantive discrimination in layoffs","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of school closures on the school-to-work transition for the children of immigrants","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overrepresentation of students from socio-economically disadvantaged backgrounds","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Language barriers and difficulties of foreign-born parents in guiding children through host-country curricula","category":"Cultural and Lifestyle Risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disproportionate burden on mothers with small children","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Communication barriers contributing to excess mortality","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The social costs of the imposed measures, such as job losses, income inequality, and reduced access to goods, may have significant negative impacts on society.","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unnecessary heterogeneity of norms and standards may hinder effective responses to disease outbreaks and decrease resilience in the built environment.","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Cultural differences in perceiving and understanding recommendations for the built environment","category":"Cultural and Lifestyle Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cooperation between stakeholders","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of awareness on the link between demolition waste management and risk of vbds","category":"Access to infrastructure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urbanization leading to increased impact on health","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of materials that increase vector attraction into the site","category":"Access to infrastructure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Malnourished children under 5 at higher risk of contracting malaria due to food
